definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: We put our backpacks on the board and swam in the water pushing the board.
sentences.chinese: 我们把背包放到木板上，推着木板在水里游。

sentences.english: We put our backpacks on the board and swam in the water pushing the board.
sentences.chinese: 我们把背包放到木板上，推着木板在水里游。

sentences.english: It was a tall, red brick building with windows boarded up on every side of the building.
sentences.chinese: 校舍很高，用红砖砌成，每面窗户都用木板封住了。

sentences.english: When you've fastened the boards, tie the strings off so that they don't slip.
sentences.chinese: 木板钉牢后，把绳子打结系紧，免得松脱。

sentences.english: They knocked together two rough mailboxes with wooden boards.
sentences.chinese: 他们用木板草草地做成了两个粗糙的信箱。

sentences.english: The carpenter put the edges of the boards in line.
sentences.chinese: 木匠把木板挨边放整齐。

sentences.english: At that side also of the tabernacle, that looketh toward the north, he made twenty boards.
sentences.chinese: 为帐棚的另一面，即北边，也做了二十块木板。

sentences.english: Dantes now left the piece of wood and began to swim to meet it.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯现在舍弃了那块破木板，开始向它游去。

sentences.english: A construction worker pushes a plank which boards up to enclose the building site in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 上海，建筑工人托起木板，封住工地。

sentences.english: Dying fish were flopping about on the wooden boards.
sentences.chinese: 快要死的鱼在木板上吧嗒吧嗒地乱嘣。

sentences.english: With old mill boards and sea-green slates.
sentences.chinese: 用老磨房的木板和海青色的条石。

sentences.english: And they shall be put along by the midst of the boards from one end to the other.
sentences.chinese: 在木板中间的那根横木，应从这头穿到那头。

sentences.english: Stone patios and a wooden deck provide opportunities for lounging and watching the sun rise over the lake.
sentences.chinese: 石头和木板平台为休闲和观看湖面的日落提供了时光。

sentences.english: It's no easy to pound a nail into a hard board.
sentences.chinese: 把钉子敲进硬木板不容易。

definition: flat piece of wood/wood chip/CL:塊|块[kuai4],片[pian4]
